trans-unit.source: Find a package family name (PFN) for per-app VPN | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Find a package family name (PFN) for per-app VPN | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Find a PFN so that you can configure a per-app VPN.
trans-unit.target: Find a PFN so that you can configure a per-app VPN.

trans-unit.source: Find a package family name (PFN) for per-app VPN configuration
trans-unit.target: Find a package family name (PFN) for per-app VPN configuration

trans-unit.source: There are two ways to find a PFN so that you can set up a per-app VPN.
trans-unit.target: There are two ways to find a PFN so that you can set up a per-app VPN.

trans-unit.source: Find a PFN for an app that's installed on a Windows 10 computer
trans-unit.target: Find a PFN for an app that's installed on a Windows 10 computer

trans-unit.source: If the app that you are working with is already installed on a Windows 10 computer, you can use the [Get-AppxPackage](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh856044.aspx) PowerShell cmdlet to get the PFN.
trans-unit.target: If the app that you are working with is already installed on a Windows 10 computer, you can use the [Get-AppxPackage](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh856044.aspx) PowerShell cmdlet to get the PFN.

trans-unit.source: The syntax for Get-AppxPackage is:
trans-unit.target: The syntax for Get-AppxPackage is:

trans-unit.source: You may have to run PowerShell as an admin to retrieve the PFN.
trans-unit.target: You may have to run PowerShell as an admin to retrieve the PFN.

trans-unit.source: For example, to get info about all the universal apps installed on the computer, use `Get-AppxPackage`.
trans-unit.target: For example, to get info about all the universal apps installed on the computer, use `Get-AppxPackage`.

trans-unit.source: To get info about an app when you know the name or part of the name, use `Get-AppxPackage *<app_name>`.
trans-unit.target: To get info about an app when you know the name or part of the name, use `Get-AppxPackage *<app_name>`.

trans-unit.source: Note the use of the wildcard character, which is particularly helpful if you're not sure of the full name of the app.
trans-unit.target: Note the use of the wildcard character, which is particularly helpful if you're not sure of the full name of the app.

trans-unit.source: For example, to get the info for OneNote, use `Get-AppxPackage *OneNote`.
trans-unit.target: For example, to get the info for OneNote, use `Get-AppxPackage *OneNote`.

trans-unit.source: Here is the information retrieved for OneNote:
trans-unit.target: Here is the information retrieved for OneNote:

trans-unit.source: Find a PFN if the app is not installed on a computer
trans-unit.target: Find a PFN if the app is not installed on a computer

trans-unit.source: Go to https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/store/apps.
trans-unit.target: Go to https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/store/apps.

trans-unit.source: Enter the name of the app in the search bar.
trans-unit.target: Enter the name of the app in the search bar.

trans-unit.source: In our example, search for OneNote.
trans-unit.target: In our example, search for OneNote.

trans-unit.source: Choose the link to the app.
trans-unit.target: Choose the link to the app.

trans-unit.source: Note that the URL has a series of letters at the end.
trans-unit.target: Note that the URL has a series of letters at the end.

trans-unit.source: In our example, the URL looks like this: `https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/store/apps/onenote/9wzdncrfhvjl`.
trans-unit.target: In our example, the URL looks like this: `https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/store/apps/onenote/9wzdncrfhvjl`.

trans-unit.source: In a different tab, paste the following URL, `https://bspmts.mp.microsoft.com/v1/public/catalog/Retail/Products/<app id>/applockerdata`.
trans-unit.target: In a different tab, paste the following URL, `https://bspmts.mp.microsoft.com/v1/public/catalog/Retail/Products/<app id>/applockerdata`.

trans-unit.source: Replace `<app id>` with the app id that you got from https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/store/apps - that series of letters at the end of the URL in step 3.
trans-unit.target: Replace `<app id>` with the app id that you got from https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/store/apps - that series of letters at the end of the URL in step 3.

trans-unit.source: In our example of OneNote, you'd paste: `https://bspmts.mp.microsoft.com/v1/public/catalog/Retail/Products/9wzdncrfhvjl/applockerdata`.
trans-unit.target: In our example of OneNote, you'd paste: `https://bspmts.mp.microsoft.com/v1/public/catalog/Retail/Products/9wzdncrfhvjl/applockerdata`.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Edge shows the information that you want; in Internet Explorer, choose **Open** to see the information.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Edge shows the information that you want; in Internet Explorer, choose **Open** to see the information.

trans-unit.source: The PFN value is given on the first line.
trans-unit.target: The PFN value is given on the first line.

trans-unit.source: Here are the results for our example:
trans-unit.target: Here are the results for our example:
